intro: Noccaea sintenisii subsp. sintenisii, commonly known as the European watercress, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its rosette of pinnately lobed leaves and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils along streams, ponds, and wet meadows. It has a short life cycle, completing its growth and reproduction within a single growing season. Its seeds are small and often dispersed by water, contributing to its distribution in suitable habitats.
